donor_name: UN DEPT OF ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL AFFAIRS
ARAB GULF PROGRAMME FOR UN DEVELOPMENT &
outputs.output_descr: The overall strategy is to introduce Area-Based development approach and support the establishment of an integrated planning and implementation framework for a comprehensive (multi-sector, multi-level and multi-agency), coordinated, pro-poor and pro-growth approach to sustainable development at rayon and ayil-okmotyus' levels. Local government and communities in selected geographical areas better address complex development problems using ABD approach.

outputs.output_descr: The overall strategy is to introduce Area-Based development approach and support the establishment of an integrated planning and implementation framework for a comprehensive (multi-sector, multi-level and multi-agency), coordinated, pro-poor and pro-growth approach to sustainable development at rayon and ayil-okmotyus' levels. Local government and communities in selected geographical areas better address complex development problems using ABD approach.

The overall strategy is to introduce Area-Based development approach and support the establishment of an integrated planning and implementation framework for a comprehensive (multi-sector, multi-level and multi-agency), coordinated, pro-poor and pro-growth approach to sustainable development at rayon and ayil-okmotyus' levels. Local government and communities in selected geographical areas better address complex development problems using ABD approach.

Realistic and sustainable capacity of volunteerism and civic engagement in disaster risk reduction sphere identified and effectively operationalized in order to scale up results in DRMP further activities in highly disaster prone areas.

The sustainable multi-sectoral forest management approach is applicable in other Central Asian countries and leads to better conservation of globally important biodiversity of riparian forests ecosystems, increase carbon sequestration, stop and decrease land degradation processes in riparian forests and increase the income of population.

The objective is to strengthen capacity of communities and local authorities to increase food security and alleviate poverty through better agricultural production and processing practices; thus empowering rural communities in the remote and low-growth areas through improvement of seed-growing capacity and fruit gardening/drying practices

The project focuses support on national institutions in conflict prevention functions, including early warning and early response mechanisms, and conflict sensitive law-making. Finally, the project works on three societal levels to support early warning and early response; at the national level, at the provincial level and at the local level, through the strengthening of existing local actors and conflict resolution mechanisms.

project_descr: Local government and communities in selected geographical areas better address complex development problems using this approach
